intro: Arctous, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are characterized by their showy, often pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Arctous species are perennial herbs with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The genus includes several species, such as Arctous alpina, which is native to the northern hemisphere.
